definition: white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: You cannot consider blacklisting or whitelisting to be a foolproof solution.
sentences.chinese: 不能把黑名單或白名單作爲一種絕對安全的解決方案。

sentences.english: 1 boasted new whitelisting and security features.
sentences.chinese: 1的亮點是新的白名單機制和安全特性。

sentences.english: Whitelist and blacklist addresses are now file-glob-style patterns, so friend@somewhere.com, *@isp.com, or *.domain.net
sentences.chinese: 白名單和黑名單都可以使用通配符。

sentences.english: However, whitelisting is generally considered the more secure option.
sentences.chinese: 但是，人們通常認爲白名單是更加安全的選擇。
